title: Man leads police on chase after shooting
text: LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) - A man is facing charges after he opened fire on a person that answered his knock on the door. An arrest report says Malcolm K. Dickerson, 37, was arrested after leading police on a chase. Louisville Metro police said Dickerson went to a home in the 1700 block of Wilson Avenue just after 10:20 p.m. April 19 looking for the mother of his child. When a man opened the door police said Dickerson fired for to five shots into the door. Dickerson fled in his car after the shooting. [ ] When Dickerson's car was located by officers he led them on a pursuit that lasted about 10 minutes before wrecking the car into a house in the 4000 block of W. Broadway. Dickerson them fled on foot, but was arrested in the 600 block of S. 40th Street. Police said Dickerson had a stolen .45 caliber handgun on him when he was taken into custody. The caliber matched the evidence found at the scene of the shooting. The wounded man was taken to University of Louisville Hospital for treatment. Dickerson was booked into Louisville metro Corrections on charges of assault, criminal mischief, receiving stolen property, possession of a handgun by a convicted felon and two counts of fleeing or evading police.
